And therefore I am throughly convinced in Conſcience of the falſeneſſe of the malignant Church of England, And of the evill of all other States which are contrary to Chriſts Inſtitutions, knowing that our great high Prieſt, who is holy, harmeleſs, undefiled, and ſeparated from ſinners Heb. 7. 26. would have his people avoid all manner and meaſure of ſpirituall Communion 2 Cor. 6. 14-17. with ſuch, he having called us Rev. 18. 4. from the fellowſhip of Devills 1 Cor. 10. 20, 21. and wicked men 2 Cor. 6. 17. that we may not in a way of ſpirituall worſhip ſit with mortall men of falſe vanity, nor goe in with diſſemblers, but hate the Church of evill doers, and not fit with the wicked. Pſal. 26. 4, 5. Therefore according to Chriſts Inſtitutions and Commandements being with my Seed Exo. 10. 9. and ſubſtance V. 25, 26. fully ſeparated, not onely from them, but alſo from thoſe, who communicate with them, either in their Publick Congregations, or private ſocieties; I doe reſolve, through the grace of the ever-living-God, who hath brought me out of Babell, never to returne to their vaine inventions, their humane deviſes, abominable Idolatries, nor ſuperſtitious high places which were built and dedicated to Idolatry, but to abſtaine from all appearance of evill 1 Theſ. 5. 22. and to worſhip God onely in ſpirit and truth Joh. 4. 24. according to that manner, which he hath preſcribed in his word, without adding or diminiſhing. Deut. 4. 2. Prov. 30. 6. Rev. 22. 18, 19. And through the light of the holy Scriptures, I clearly ſee, not onely the neceſſity of this holy way of Separation, in obedience to the heavenly Call, but alſo the great need of continuing in Chriſtian Fellowſhip, Communion, and Society of Saints, And that to be of the Viſible Particular Church of Chriſt, is moſt needfull for the Sain • s edification in this life; For to that heavenly company is committed the Oracles of God Rom. 3. 2. By them the Kingly, Prieſtly, Propheticall, and Apoſtolicall Offices of Jeſus Chriſt is to be ſet forth; For the King and Lord of all adminiſtrations 1 Cor. 12. 5. who is that great Prophet Acts 3. 22, 23.
